intro: Licania roraimensis, commonly known as the Roraima licania, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and palm-like appearance. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of dense tropical forests. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
